snippet: Markets ended the week on an upswing on the belief that global central banks will respond accordingly if Sunday’s election in Greece sets off turmoil.
abstract: Stocks rally for a second straight week on hopes that global central banks will take action if the impending Greek elections set off market turmoil; optimism helps offset the latest round of weak economic data in the United States, which points to sluggish growth
lead_paragraph: Markets ended the week on an upswing on the belief that global central banks will respond accordingly if Sunday’s election in Greece sets off turmoil.

headline.main: Indexes Rally on Hopes Banks Will Counter Turmoil
headline.print_headline: Indexes Rally on Hopes Banks Will Counter Turmoil
